sense.name: a moving single-file configuration of a large military unit
sense.examples: They rode at the head of the troop column. There are reports of tank columns advancing on our 2nd battalion. They suspect the New York group may be a fifth column for an overseas terrorist network. (sympathizers, saboteurs)

sense.name: an architectural component, a vertical support structure
sense.examples: Corinthian columns support the portico above the veranda of the old mansion. The truck hit a load-bearing column in the parking garage. Many of the building's columns were knocked down during the earthquake.

sense.name: anything with a long cylindrical form
sense.examples: We could see a column of smoke rising from the chimney of the cottage. The x-ray shows an injury to the spinal column. This steering column is designed to collapse during impact. Towering columns of storm clouds were gathering in the distance.

sense.name: a regular feature, or piece, in a newspaper
sense.examples: She writes a political column for the local newspaper. Sally always reads the gossip columns.

sense.name: a static vertical layout, e.g. text or numbers
sense.examples: John used a calculator to add up the long column of numbers. This newspaper sells space in four-inch columns. The wide boulevard was lined with columns of trees. (long narrow arrangement of trees) The shell script reported a bug on line sixteen, column four of the file.

sense.name: a glass tube used in chromatography
sense.examples: The assistant dropped a chromatography column on the laboratory floor. What is the substance contained in those two columns?
